recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the server supports IDEA ciphers

recommendation.shortName: Support for only PFS cipher suites

propertyRecommendations.shortDescription: Not all cipher suites are perfect forward secure

recommendation.shortName: Support for session resumption with session tickets
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the server supports session resumption with session tickets

propertyRecommendations.shortDescription: Session tickets are disabled
propertyRecommendations.handlingRecommendation: Enable session resumption with session tickets

recommendation.shortName: Support for session resumption with session IDs
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the server supports session resumption with session IDs
Evaluates whether the server supports session resumption with session tickets whose keys are being rotated
recommendation.detailedDescription: Session tickets are created with symmetric keys. The lifetime of the symmetric keys used for session tickets should be restricted to reduce the attack surface. The ticket lifetime is typically indicated in the ticket lifetime hint.

propertyRecommendations.shortDescription: Session resumption with rotating session tickets is disabled
propertyRecommendations.handlingRecommendation: Frequently changing session ticket keys improves the security, enable rotated session tickets.

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the server supports secure renegotiation extension.

propertyRecommendations.shortDescription: Secure renegotiation extension is disabled
propertyRecommendations.handlingRecommendation: Consider to enable secure renegotiation extension.

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the server supports client-side secure renegotiation.
recommendation.detailedDescription: Secure renegotiation can be started by the client as well as by the server. In its configuration the server can restrict the support for the server-side secure renegotiation. In that case, only the server can start the renegotiation process.

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the server supports client-side secure renegotiation.
recommendation.detailedDescription: Secure renegotiation can be started by the client as well as by the server. In its configuration the server can restrict the support for the server-side secure renegotiation. In that case, only the server can start the renegotiation process.

recommendation.shortName: TLS Fallback Signaling Cipher Suite Value (SCSV) support
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the server supports TLS Fallback Signaling Cipher Suite Value (SCSV)
recommendation.detailedDescription: In order to establish the highest possible TLS version, TLS clients attempt to perform several TLS handshake starting with the one with the highest version. If a TLS handshake with a particular version does not work, the TLS client attempts to execute the handshake with a lower version. This of course allows an attacker to downgrade the TLS connection. TLS Fallback Signaling Cipher Suite Value (SCSV) was introduced to prevent downgrade attacks. For example, if a TLS client attempts to establish a TLS 1.1 connection after an unsuccessful TLS 1.2 handshake attempt, it includes a TLS SCSV cipher suite into the ClientHello message. The server accepts this handshake if and only if its highest version is TLS 1.1.

propertyRecommendations.shortDescription: TLS SCSV is disabled
propertyRecommendations.handlingRecommendation: Enable TLS Fallback Signaling Cipher Suite Value (SCSV)

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the server supports TLS compression

propertyRecommendations.shortDescription: TLS compression is supported
propertyRecommendations.handlingRecommendation: Disable TLS compression
